definition: to bury a corpse/to be buried/(fig.) to die (at sea, in a fire etc)
old variant of 葬[zang4]
to bury (the dead)/to inter
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown

sentences.english: Jeff: I'm just afraid that you're going to burn in Hell for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我只是担心，你将会因为这一切而死无葬身之地。

sentences.english: Do you have any doubts that he's dead and at the bottom of the sea?
sentences.chinese: 你对他的死亡和葬身海底的说法有所怀疑吗？

sentences.english: The sinking ship carried down with her the captain and many passengers.
sentences.chinese: 沉船使船长和许多乘客葬身海底。

sentences.english: Dozens of ships were washed ashore and more dozens were buried at the bottom of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 几十艘船被抛上海滩，更多的船只则葬身海底。

sentences.english: In the end, 31 people died and many more were injured.
sentences.chinese: 最后有三十一个人葬身火窟，更多的人身受重伤。

sentences.english: It was in the treacherous Bay of Biscay, however, where he nearly met with a watery grave .
sentences.chinese: 而在变化无常的比思开湾，他几乎葬身鱼腹。
当时有超过400人葬身大海。

sentences.english: If marriage is love's gravestone, then those who do not marry die in unnamed graves.
sentences.chinese: 如果婚姻是爱情的坟墓，没有婚姻就是死无葬身之地。

sentences.english: The ship was hit by a hurricane and some sailors were buried at sea.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船在海上遇到飓风，一些水手葬身海底。

sentences.english: The ship hit an iceberg and buried at sea.
sentences.chinese: 这条船撞上了冰山葬身海底。

sentences.english: Will new technologies kill the mail?
sentences.chinese: 新技术会不会让邮件死无葬身之地？

sentences.english: He was a fine seaman , but ended up in Davy Jones ' locker.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名好水手，但是最后竟葬身海底了。

sentences.english: If he's gone to the bottom of the ocean we may still find bits of the boat floating.
sentences.chinese: 如果他已葬身海底，我们还可能发现漂浮着的船板。

sentences.english: Today, a 12 year old boy died in a house fire near my neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我家附近一名12岁的男孩葬身火场。

sentences.english: In Memorial of Lossen Souls Who Perished with RMS Titanic.
sentences.chinese: 悼念和铁达尼号葬身大洋的灵魂。

definition: to lose one's life
to die/to perish
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
to die/to lose one's life
variant of 殞命|殒命[yun3 ming4]/to die/to perish
lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown
eternal rest (i.e. death)
to meet violent death/to get killed
annihilated/capsized
to be decapitated (idiom)
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to lose one's life/to get killed
lit. torn body and crushed bones (idiom)/fig. to die horribly/to sacrifice one's life
to die in tragic circumstances
